string-array.name: value
string-array.item: adb means Android Debug Bridge. It is a command line tool to communicate with an emulator or connected Android device. For example, \'adb install GradleProject-debug.apk\' is a command to install an apk file into your android virtual device.
The emulator used to test and develop Android applications without using a physical device. For example, \'emulator -avd myPhone &\' is a command to display an Android Phone\'s emulator.
The android tool is used to create, delete, and view Android Virtual Devices. For example, \'android list avd\' is a command to list the AVD that exists inside the project.
screenshot2 is a command to take a photo of your running device\'s screen. For example, \'screenshot2 -e name.png\', is a command to take a screenshot and save it as a png file.
gradle is a build toolkit that manages dependencies. For example, \'gradle build\' is a command to build the gradle.
pm means Package Manager is used to deal with package. For example, \'pm list packages\' is a command to list all installed packages.

Lint is a tool to check the Android project source file for potential bugs and optimization improvements for correctness, security, and etc. For example, \'lint --html lint.html GradleProject\' is a command to check the project\'s potential errors and generate a html file to display the details of the errors or warnings.

It contains 3 directories which are \'java\', \'org\', and \'hello\'. It also has a xml file \'AndroidManifest\' which is inside the \'main\' directory and a java file \'HelloActivity\' which is inside the \'hello\' directory and used to display messages.

It contains 3 directories which are \'apk\', \'lint-results_files\', and \'tmp\'. Inside the \'apk\' directory, there are 3 apk files, 1 png file, and 2 text file. Inside the \'lint-results_files\' directory, there are 3 png files and 1 css file. Inside the \'tmp\' directory, there are two empty directories. There are also 1 xml file and 1 html file inside the \'outputs\' directory.
It is a project which contains everything that defines Android apps, from app source code to build configuration and test code.
It is the primary place that can be create an Android app which contains tools, source code, and etc.
It is the second row from the top of the Android Studio which contains a selection of shortcuts to frequently performed actions.
It is on the bottom of Android Studio which displays informational messages about the project and the activities.
It can be seen in the upper right corner to add a preview window.
It is on the bottom which stands for Android DDMS that can be used when you running your virtual device, such as screenshot.
It is in the upper left corner to explore the whole project folder.
It is a hidden folder inside the project folder which contains libraries folder, workspace.xml, gradle.xml, and etc.
It provides elements and attributes, and in a few cases values for everything from Layouts to Manifests.
It is a component of app that can be built, tested, or debuged independently. Modules contain the source code and resources for the app.
When you are running your virtual device, you can see the live layout from it.
It creates an empty Git repository or reinitialize an existing one.
When creating or doing some modifies for the project, the commit command can records these changes and be ready to be pushed to the github.
The push command can update the remote github\'s folder and upload your projects to the website.
The add command can add files to the index.
The pull command fetch from the remote repository and merge it.
The brand command list, create, and delete branch.
The clone command copies a repository into a new directory.
